item.title: 精神航空再次拒绝边疆集团的收购要约
item.description: 精神航空公司（Spirit Airlines）周二表示，该公司拒绝了边疆集团（Frontier Group）的最新收购要约。【原文：Spirit Airlines on Tuesday said it has rejected the most recent acquisition offer from Frontier Group .】

item.title: 印度央行大力干预外汇交易后将注入创纪录的隔夜资金
item.description: 在过去两个交易日积极干预外汇市场之后，印度央行将于周三通过隔夜注资的方式向银行系统注入创纪录数量的资金。【原文：India's central bank will infuse a record quantum of funds into the banking system through an overnight infusion on Wednesday, after it aggressively intervened in the foreign exchange (FX) market in the last two sessions.】

item.title: 独家消息消息人士称，日本 Eneos 公司的目标是在金属业务部门的首次公开募股中筹集至少 26 亿美元资金
item.description: 据两位熟知内情的消息人士透露，日本最大的炼油商 Eneos 控股公司计划在其全资子公司 JX 高级金属公司的首次公开募股中筹集至少 4000 亿日元（合 26.1 亿美元）的资金。【原文：Japan's largest oil refiner, Eneos Holdings , aims to raise at least 400 billion yen ($2.61 billion) in the initial public offering of its wholly owned subsidiary, JX Advanced Metals, according to two sources familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 富士康的目标是与日产合作，而非收购
item.description: 富士康董事长刘永好周三表示，公司的目标是与日本日产合作，而不是收购。【原文：Foxconn Chairman Young Liu said on Wednesday that the company's aim is cooperation with Japan's Nissan , not acquisition.】

item.title: 美国原油库存报告后油价回落
item.description: 周三，油价下跌，原因是一份行业报告显示美国原油库存增加，以及关税忧虑打压了市场情绪，油价缩减了三天来受中东紧张局势加剧和制裁加强推动的涨幅。【原文：Oil prices fell on Wednesday as an industry report showed an increase in U.S. crude stockpiles and tariff worries weighed on sentiment, paring back three days of gains driven by increasing Middle East tensions and intensifying sanctions.】

item.title: 中国锦江集团与华纳兄弟在上海签署哈利-波特主题公园框架协议
item.description: 中国锦江国际集团周三在其微信社交媒体账户上发布公告称，该集团已与华纳兄弟公司签署合资框架协议，将在上海开发哈利-波特主题公园。【原文：China's Jinjiang International Group has signed a joint venture framework agreement with Warner Bros to develop a Harry Potter theme park in Shanghai, according to an announcement on Jinjiang's WeChat social media account, published on Wednesday.】

item.title: 日本央行行长上田表示日本食品通胀可能不是暂时的
item.description: 日本央行行长上田一夫（Kazuo Ueda）周三表示，央行将在实施货币政策时考虑到食品价格可能继续高企并影响人们通胀预期的风险。【原文：Bank of Japan Governor Kazuo Ueda said on Wednesday the central bank will conduct monetary policy bearing in mind there are risks that food prices may continue to be high and affect people's inflation expectations.】

item.title: 美元在美国消费者物价指数公布前稍事喘息
item.description: 在交易商等待美国通胀数据和更广泛的贸易方面的消息之际，美元从关税推动的涨势中回落，跌破近期高点。【原文：The dollar took a step back from its tariff-driven rally, leaving it below recent peaks as traders waited on U.S. inflation data and news on the broader trade front.】

item.title: 特朗普的加密货币公司启动战略 "代币储备
item.description: 世界自由金融公司（World Liberty Financial）是美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）持有金融股份的新加密货币平台，该公司宣布将推出战略代币储备，旨在支持比特币、以太坊和其他加密货币，"这些货币正处于重塑全球金融的最前沿"。【原文：World Liberty Financial, the new crypto platform in which President Donald Trump holds a financial stake, announced that it was unveiling a strategic token reserve designed to bolster Bitcoin, Ethereum and other cryptocurrencies "that are at the forefront of reshaping global finance."】

item.title: 洛杉矶大火后，加州寻求保险公司提供 10 亿美元以支持 FAIR 计划
item.description: 加州保险专员里卡多-拉拉（Ricardo Lara）要求委员会成员保险公司提供 10 亿美元的额外资金，以支持州政府支持的 FAIR 计划。【原文：California Insurance Commissioner Ricardo Lara has requested $1 billion in additional funds from the commission's member insurers to shore up the state-backed FAIR Plan after wildfires ravaged swathes of land in and around Los Angeles last month.】

item.title: Atome Financial 为贝莱德和 InnoVen 提供 8000 万美元信贷服务
item.description: 总部位于新加坡的金融技术公司Atome Financial周三表示，该公司已获得由资产管理公司贝莱德（BlackRock）和风险债务提供商InnoVen Capital管理的私人信贷基金8000万美元的私人信贷融资。【原文：Singapore-based financial technology firm Atome Financial said on Wednesday it had secured a private credit fund managed by asset manager BlackRock and venture debt provider InnoVen Capital in a $80 million private credit facility.】

item.title: 日本要求美国将日本排除在钢铝关税之外
item.description: 日本工业大臣武藤洋治周三表示，日本已请求美国豁免日本的钢铝关税。【原文：Japan industry minister Yoji Muto said on Wednesday the nation has requested that the United States exempt Japan from steel and aluminium tariffs.】

item.title: 墨西哥机场运营商 GAP 将在 2029 年前投资 25 亿美元
item.description: 墨西哥机场运营商 GAP 周二宣布，将在五年内投资 520 亿比索（约合 25.3 亿美元），这是其发展计划的一部分，旨在支持经济增长和该国的主要旅游业。【原文：Mexican airport operator GAP on Tuesday announced a 52-billion-peso ($2.53 billion) investment spread across five years, part of what it described as a development plan that aims to support economic growth and the country's key tourism sector.】

item.title: 一月份全球电动汽车销量增长 18
item.description: 研究公司Rho Motion周三表示，1月份全球电动汽车和插电式混合动力汽车销量同比增长18%，欧洲和美国的增长速度自去年2月以来首次超过中国。【原文：Global electric and plug-in hybrid vehicle sales in January rose 18% year on year, as growth in Europe and the United States outpaced China for the first time since last February, research firm Rho Motion said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 白宫官员称，美国 25% 的钢铁关税将与对加拿大的其他征税叠加
item.description: 一位白宫官员周二表示，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普计划对所有钢铁和铝进口商品征收的25%关税将被加到对加拿大商品征收的其他关税上，从而导致总计50%的关税。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump's planned 25% tariffs on all steel and aluminum imports would be added onto other levies on Canadian goods, resulting in a total 50% tariff, a White House official said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 爱迪生公用事业公司因洛杉矶野火面临股东诉讼
item.description: 南加州爱迪生公司（Southern California Edison）的母公司因涉嫌在最近洛杉矶地区野火发生之前欺骗股东，向他们保证可以关闭输电线以降低灾难性损失的风险而遭到起诉。【原文：The parent company of Southern California Edison has been sued for allegedly defrauding shareholders before the recent Los Angeles-area wildfires by assuring them it could shut down power lines to reduce the risk of catastrophic damage.】

item.title: 很少有人悼念美国便士，特朗普却要扼杀它
item.description: 曼哈顿 All-Star Deli & Grocery 的收银员努尔-伊斯梅尔（Nour Ismail）说，一天结束时扔进杂货店小费罐的几分钱大多是一种骚扰，而不是对良好服务的欢迎奖励。【原文：Nour Ismail, a cashier at the All-Star Deli & Grocery in Manhattan, says the handful of pennies tossed into the bodega's tip jar by the end of the day is mostly a nuisance, rather than a welcome reward for good service.】

item.title: 巴拿马运河 1 月份过境量近一年来首次下降
item.description: 根据巴拿马运河管理机构周二发布的公告，世界第二繁忙水道--巴拿马运河的船舶数量在 1 月份下降到平均每天 32.6 艘，共计 1011 艘，这是近一年以来的首次月度环比下降。【原文：The number of vessels that passed through the Panama Canal, the world's second busiest waterway, fell to an average of 32.6 per day for a total of 1,011 ships in January, the first month-on-month decline in almost a year, according to a bulletin published on Tuesday by the canal's administrating authority.】

item.title: 澳大利亚通过关键矿产税收激励法
item.description: 澳大利亚议会已通过法律，为重要矿产和可再生氢气的生产提供税收减免，以推动能源转型计划，实现到2050年净零排放的目标，并减少对中国的依赖。【原文：Australia's parliament has passed laws that would give production tax breaks for critical minerals and renewable hydrogen, in a boost for energy transition plans as it aims to hit net zero emissions by 2050, and reduce dependence on China.】

item.title: 泰国赌场的豪赌取决于法规的细枝末节
item.description: 泰国正把目光投向成为全球博彩中心，计划建立一个能带来数十亿美元收入、吸引一些业界巨头并有利于旅游业繁荣的赌场业。【原文：Thailand is setting its sights on becoming a global gaming hub, with plans to build a casino industry that generates billions in revenue, draws some of the biggest names in the business and benefits a thriving tourism sector.】

item.title: 第一量子公司巴拿马科布雷铜矿最终听证会推迟至 2026 年举行
item.description: 加拿大第一量子公司（First Quantum）周二表示，根据国际商会程序，Cobre Panamá矿的最终听证会已从今年 9 月推迟到 2026 年 2 月。【原文：Canada's First Quantum said on Tuesday, the final hearing, for the Cobre Panamá mine, under the International Chamber of Commerce proceedings has been moved to February 2026 from September of the current year.】

item.title: 早间交易科技刺破贸易阴霾，软银发布报告
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 马斯克抨击参与特朗普政策挑战的律师事务所
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的亿万富翁盟友埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）周二将矛头指向了美国的律师事务所，这些事务所与权益团体合作，在法庭上挑战共和党人的全面政策变革。【原文：President Donald Trump's billionaire ally Elon Musk on Tuesday directed his ire at U.S. law firms that have teamed up with advocacy groups to challenge the Republican's sweeping policy changes in court.】

item.title: 墨西哥电信巨头 America Movil 的利润因外汇损失而下滑
item.description: 墨西哥电信巨头 America Movil 周二公布，其第四季度净利润下降 48%，远低于分析师预期。【原文：Mexican telecommunications giant America Movil on Tuesday reported a 48% fall in its fourth-quarter net profit, well below analysts' expectations, with the company citing foreign-exchange losses even as its revenues rose.】

item.title: 超微公司将在 2 月截止日期前提交延迟的年度报告
item.description: 超微计算机公司（Super Micro Computer）周二表示，该公司相信能够在 2 月 25 日前向美国证券交易委员会提交延迟的年度报告，此前该公司未能在 8 月份的最后期限前提交 10-K 报告。【原文：Super Micro Computer said on Tuesday it believes it will be able to file its delayed annual report with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission by February 25, after failing to submit the 10-K report by the August deadline.】

item.title: 吉利德公司季度业绩超出预期
item.description: 吉利德科学公司周二公布的第四季度业绩超出华尔街预期，原因是其艾滋病药物销售额增长了 16%，收购相关成本下降。【原文：Gilead Sciences posted fourth-quarter results that exceeded Wall Street estimates on Tuesday as its HIV drug sales rose 16% and acquisition-related costs fell.】

item.title: DoorDash 节假日期间在线订单强劲，季度收入超出预期
item.description: 本周二，DoorDash 的季度营收和订单总量均超过了分析师的预期，因为顾客在节日期间都会通过其在线平台购买从食品、杂货到酒类等各种商品。【原文：DoorDash topped analysts' estimate for quarterly revenue and total orders on Tuesday, as customers turned to its online platform to buy everything from food and groceries to alcohol during the holiday season.】

item.title: 与优步的激烈竞争令 Lyft 第一季度预订量预期承压
item.description: Lyft 周二预计，本季度总预订量将低于预期，因为该公司正在与更大的竞争对手优步（Uber Technologies）争夺更多的乘客，而野火和极端天气事件扰乱了其在一些关键市场的业务。【原文：Lyft forecast current-quarter gross bookings below estimates on Tuesday, as its jostles for more riders with larger rival Uber Technologies , while wildfires and extreme weather events disrupted its business in some key markets.】

item.title: 澳大利亚顶级银行 CBA 上半年利润超预期
item.description: 澳大利亚联邦银行（Commonwealth Bank of Australia）周三公布的上半年现金收益好于预期，主要得益于其房屋贷款和存款产品组合的强劲增长，以及贷款减值支出的减少。【原文：Commonwealth Bank of Australia reported better-than-expected first-half cash earnings on Wednesday, helped by robust volume growth across its home lending and deposit products portfolio as well as a lower loan impairment expense.】

item.title: 美联储威廉姆斯称货币政策正处于实现美联储目标的正确位置
item.description: 纽约联邦储备银行行长约翰-威廉姆斯（John Williams）周二表示，目前的短期利率水平应有助于使通胀率回到央行设定的2%的目标，但他的评论并未就更多降息的前景提供任何指导。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of New York President John Williams said Tuesday the current level of short-term interest rates should help get inflation back to the central bank's 2% target, in comments that offered no guidance about the prospect for more rate cuts.】
